title: Dal khichdi|Yellow lentils rice| One pot cooking |Easy Lunch Recipe
content:
Lunch recipe: Dal Khichdi Servings : 2 Duration: 30 mins Dal khichdi is a kind of thick porridge ğŸ¥£Â which contains mixed vegetables, Yellow lentils, rice, spices, cilantro, mint leaves and few add ons. Itâ€™s so simple to make and a good way to have healthy food with lots of vegetables. A quick meal packed with veggies, protein and spices cooked in one-pot, you can cook either in pressure cooker or electric cooker both works out well. This dish originated from both south India and North India but I made few changes in my recipe which turned out tasty, healthy and authentic. I hope you could try and enjoy ğŸ˜Š Letâ€™s start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Split Yellow Moong Dal/ Yellow Lentils - 80 gms ( wash & soak 15 mins)
  • White Rice - 80 gms ( wash twice and keep aside)
  • Carrot - 1 - Diced - ( Peel off )
  • Red Radish - 5 - diced
  • White radish - 1 - Diced ( Peel off)
  • Onion - 1 small - diced
  • Tomato ğŸ…Â - 1 medium - finely chopped
  • Ginger garlic paste - 1/2 Tb sp
  • Mint leaves - 20 - wash & chop
  • Coriander leaves- wash & chop
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Curry leaves - 5
  • Salt - 1/2 Tb sp
  • Turmeric Powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Red chilly powder - 1 tsp
  • Green chillies - 3 - slits
  • Coriander Powder - 1 Tb sp
  • Butter - 1 Tb sp
  • Water - 560 ml
Procedure:
  • Keep a heavy bottomed pan or cooker over medium heat
  • Add butter, cumin seeds, green chillies, curry leaves. Saute a minute
  • Next add ginger garlic paste and chopped onions
  • Saute 2 mins and add tomato, mix well and stir till it becomes soft
  • Then Add Red radish, carrot and white radish, combine well.
  • Next add salt, turmeric powder, red chilly powder, coriander leaves , mint leaves and coriander leaves. Mix everything well for a minute
  • Immediately add rice and moong Dal or yellow lentils.Â Mix well and add water
  • Close with lid and put whistle, cook it over medium heat for 3 whistles
  • Turn off heat and let the pressure goes off, open lid slowly and mix well
  • Serve hot with any crunchy sides like potato chips or Â boondiÂ ğŸ˜‹
  • Happy Cooking ğŸ˜Š Happy Weekend
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust spices according to taste
  • Instead of butter you can use ghee or oil
  • If you would like to prepare for kids reduce spice level
  • You can add any vegetable as you wish to have in khichdi
